result.execSummary:
The defendant Jody L Schofield #403626 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jody L Schofield #403626 is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jody L Schofield #403626 was found guilty of 1st Degree Reckless Injury [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Repeater], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.23(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Restitution hearing to be set in 90 days  -     
**** RESTITUTION HAS BEEN SET TO "ZERO"  $0.00. ****

If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Counseling shall specifically include:  Alcohol / drug  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program. 
++  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.         ++ Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
++ Pay restitution plus surcharge -  Restitution hearing will be set in 90 days.  May Not have contact with Daniel Beascochea, anyone who uses or traffics controlled substances.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms. Seek/ Obtain stable housing.

835   Clerk HM.      State of Wisconsin appears by Atty K. Richard Wells.   Defendant, Jody L Schofield #403626, appeared.   NO appearance by victim.  Victim's request for adjmt was denied. Victim has not provided documents to prove restitution to DAs office.  DE requests restitution be set at zero - granted.    Court will prepare order.
Court grants State/VI's request for adjmt of 10/21 RSH - rescheduled to 1/13 830am.
Restitution hearing on October 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Atty Johnson unable to appear for 8/26 RSH. State agrees to reschedule to 10/21 830am.
Restitution hearing on August 26, 2016 at 09:00 am.
For Cts 2 & 3 only - Dismissed.
Presentence incarceration credit.
from Jevon Claussen/KSD.
Extended Supervision Conditions-ordered by the court

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney C Johnson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Victim present and addressed.  Court imposes a total sentence of 17 years WSP; 7 years initial confinement w/credit for 276 days served; 10 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is not eligible for CIP/SAP; deft to pay $250 DNA surcharge.  No contact with Daniel Beascochea, anyone who uses or traffics controlled substances.  DOC to determine restitution.  Restitution hearing to be set in 90 days before Commissioner Dowse.
From DA regarding additional Discovery  kmk

Atty Johnson acknowledges receipt and waives reading.  On state's motion counts 2 and 3 are dismissed.  Deft pleads guilty; court finds deft guilty.  PSI ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  SEH set for 7/8/16 @ 11:00.  Bond continued.
